chunks.original_latin:
Item idem in libro decimo ejusdem operis. Expleta vero confessione verae divinitatis veraeque
humanitatis unici Filii Dei, confitemur nos credere
in Spiritum sanctum, qui est unus spiritus Patris
et Filii, de Patre Filioque procedens, in Patre Filioque
naturaliter manens, de Patre ac Filio unius divinitatis
habens naturaliter veritatem.
chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
Also, in the tenth book of the same work, after affirming the true divinity and humanity of the only Son of God, we declare our belief in the Holy Spirit.

The Holy Spirit is one spirit with the Father and the Son, proceeding from both, naturally remaining in both, and sharing the same divine truth as the Father and the Son.
